intro: Nemosenecio yunnanensis, commonly known as the Yunnan nemosenecio, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Yunnan Province in China. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in high-altitude meadows and rocky habitats, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are usually basal, rosette-like, and have a hairy texture, while its flowers are small and clustered. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native range.
